instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, mid 2012, intel core i7 2.9ghz.....

super clean board ,... no damage or what so ever, 

not getting hd, already tried known good HD and HD cable....

folder flashing 

L4500 and L4539 both have .7 ohm , i guess those are good...


i notice all 2011 and 2012 board with i7 cpu something wrong with HD

am i missing anything !! should i change the <CHIP>U4510</CHIP>!!!

helpl!!!!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message: Used the correct cable? Tried more than 1 cable? Drive spinning up? PRAM reset? EFI lock? All that before anything else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message: Can you do PRAM reset? Can it boot to boot manager? Are you getting padlock symbol when booting to bootmanager? If so could be firmware-locked and missing OS or damaged OS. Then get firmware-password from user or remove firmware-lock from BIOS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 18923"]Used the correct cable? Tried more than 1 cable? Drive spinning up? PRAM reset? EFI lock? All that before anything else.[/QUOTE]

yes correct cable ... i have 5 of them .... PRAM reset done, no efi lock at all ...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message: We need to know if the drive is spinning up? double checked os is working on hdd? holding down options during start up does anything show up? any info behind the board its self?  check under the microscope for any thing affecting the connector on the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message: What do you see if you hold the option key with the drive plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message:
No Title

Here is the pic Ifi press option key

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board no hdd, folder flashing
threads.message: Hhhnnngggg, IS THE DRIVE SPINNING???? ffff
